else if(command.startsWith(“char”) && playerRights <= 441) {
showInterface(3559);
}
thats wat i got with mine… it works for me, try it with urs…

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

iv got a problem with my ::char command, only admins (level 2 on my server) are able to use it, now as obvious as it seems to solve this, it isn’t, because there is no specification as to what access level you need to use the command:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("char"))
showInterface(3559);
}

I have tried EVERYTHING i can think of to solve this, iv made the command so you need to be under level 3 access, i have even made a void called charf(), and in the void i put showInterface(3559); so it looks like this:

public void charf() {
showInterface(3559);
}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("char")) {
// showInterface(3559);
charf();
}

someone please help me, i don’t know what else i can do, i even tried to put the interface to open when you try to talk to one of the npc’s and nothing is working

Read full topic
